Description: Fragment of shoulder of large Vroulian pottery stamnos. Clay firm and fired a pale brown; paint dark and now dull. A rounded moulding runs along the middle of the handle. Shoulder, remains of a pendent lotus flower to left of handle and of a palmette to right. Belly, two reserved bands: top of pendent lotus flower. Decoration by incision on dark ground. Purple on petals.
Curator's comments: NA-Analysis by Prof. H. Mommsen (Helmholtz-Institut, Bonn) in 2003 revealed a group with BM GR 1888,0208.65, 1888,0208.20 & 1888,0208.16.b+17, just like the stamnos BM GR 1888,0208.42.a and the amphora BM GR 1888.0208.25
Bibliographic references: CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (Pl. GB 605, 4)
Schlotzhauer & Villing 2006 / East Greek Pottery from Naukratis: The Current State of Research (p.55 Table 1)
Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 282)
